intro: Seseli decipiens, commonly known as the deceptive seseli, is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its compound umbels and aromatic foliage. It is native to the Mediterranean region and parts of southern Europe, often found in rocky or limestone soils. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with finely divided, fern-like leaves that are often covered in a fine pubescence. Its flowers are small and white, arranged in flat-topped clusters, and it blooms from late spring to early summer. Seseli decipiens is known for its medicinal properties and has been used traditionally in herbal remedies.
